original: Dhammapaccanīyānuloma (4), Tikatikapaṭṭhānapāḷi (5)🔽23.13. Kusalattika, Hīnattika🔽Nakusalaṁ nahīnaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā akusalo hīno dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.🔽Nakusalaṁ namajjhimaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca abyākato majjhimo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā cha, adhipatiyā cha …pe… vipāke tīṇi …pe… avigate cha.
analyzed: dhamma paccanīya anuloma tika tika paṭṭhāna pāḷi  kusala attika hīna attika  na kusalam na hīnam dhammam paccayā akusalaḥ hīnaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi  na kusalam na majjhimam dhammam paṭicca abyākataḥ majjhimaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā cha adhipatiyā cha pe vipāke tīṇi pe avigate cha
translated: The Dhamma Paccanīyānuloma, Tikatikapaṭṭhānapāḷi🔽.. The wholesome triad, the inferior triad

original: Nakusalaṁ napaṇītaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā kusalo paṇīto dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā cha …pe… āsevane tīṇi …pe… vipāke tīṇi …pe… avigate cha.
analyzed: na kusalam na paṇītam dhammam paccayā kusalaḥ paṇītaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā cha pe āsevane tīṇi pe vipāke tīṇi pe avigate cha
translated: With the wholesome and the unwholesome as condition, the unwholesome and the inferior states arise, by way of root condition. (Abbreviated.)
